alert.note: Alert for Cook; DuPage; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 02 at 12:10PM CDT until July 02 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN COOK, EASTERN DUPAGE AND NORTH CENTRAL WILL COUNTIES... ...SEPARATE FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR SIGNIFICANT FLASH FLOODING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR CENTRAL COOK COUNTY... At 1210 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges continued to indicate rainfall across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen since earlier this morning with the highest totals near Burr Ridge and Willow Springs. Rainfall rates up to 0.5 inches per hour may continue for at least the next hour. Although new flash flood impacts are unlikely, ongoing rainfall may prevent flooded areas from receding. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, streets, underpasses, low-lying areas, and other poor drainage areas. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Report flooding to the National Weather Service or your local law enforcement agency only when you can do so safely.
